snippet: Volunteers who are ill after working in the exposure zone after the Sept. 11 attacks find it is difficult to file claims for compensation from a $2.8 billion fund created to pay for their medical care.
abstract: Volunteers who became ill after working at ground zero are finding it difficult to file claims for compensation from a $2.8 billion medical fund because of lack of necessary documentation; large classes of people who qualify, like firefighters, are likely to have official work orders to back them up, but scores of volunteers, some of whom spent days working on site, have only the sketchiest proof of their service.
lead_paragraph: Volunteers who are ill after working in the exposure zone after the Sept. 11 attacks find it is difficult to file claims for compensation from a $2.8 billion fund created to pay for their medical care.

headline.seo: Ground Zero Volunteers Face Obstacles to Compensation
headline.main: Volunteers at Ground Zero Now Face a Demand for Proof
headline.print_headline: Volunteers at Ground Zero Now Face a Demand for Proof

keywords.value: James Zadroga 9-11 Health and Compensation Act
keywords.name: subject
